alert.note: Alert for Vernon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 02 at 7:25AM CDT until June 04 at 4:11AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Springfield MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri... Marmaton River near Nevada affecting Vernon County. .Heavy rainfall that occurred over the Marmaton River Basin on Wednesday will cause the river to rise above flood stage. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Marmaton River near Nevada. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, minor flooding occurs near the gage site and affects low lying areas along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 19.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this morning to 20.6 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 730 AM CDT.
